skill.name: no-bluff-seo-skill
skill.description: Enforce the No-Bluff SEO/GEO protocol using DataForSEO and SEMRush. Use when generating or modifying any SEO-related copy, claims, or structured data for Synthex or client sites.
skill.summary: Enforce the No-Bluff SEO/GEO protocol using DataForSEO and SEMRush. Use when generating or modifying...
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: All 16 static findings are false positives. This is a prompt-only skill containing markdown documentation. Scanner incorrectly flagged metadata URLs, markdown backtick syntax, and descriptive words as security issues. No executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond reading the skill definition.

content.user_title: Verify SEO claims with real data
content.value_statement: Marketing teams make unverified claims that damage credibility. This skill enforces a No-Bluff protocol that requires every SEO claim to be backed by DataForSEO or SEMRush data with assigned confidence scores.
actual_capabilities: Cross-check keyword metrics using DataForSEO and SEMRush APIs
Validate positioning statements against real search data
Attach source, metric type, and confidence score to all SEO insights
Generate or update JSON-LD structured data for product pages
Reject vanity metrics and unverified marketing claims
Create audit trails for all SEO actions
limitations: Does not execute API calls - relies on calling application to fetch data
Does not directly access SEO databases - requires integration
Confidence scores are estimates based on available data quality

use_cases.title: Create compliant copy
use_cases.description: Generate landing page content with verified SEO claims and proper citations

use_cases.title: Audit existing content
use_cases.description: Check existing pages for unverified claims and flag issues for correction

use_cases.title: Build audit reports
use_cases.description: Produce client reports documenting SEO data sources and confidence levels

prompt_templates.title: Quick keyword check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the search volume and ranking difficulty for [keyword] using DataForSEO. Report the metric with source and confidence score.

prompt_templates.title: Validate claim
prompt_templates.prompt: Is the claim '[specific claim]' verifiable? Check against DataForSEO or SEMRush data and assign a confidence score.

prompt_templates.title: Generate structured data
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate JSON-LD schema for this product page. Include proper markup and confidence scores for all metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Full SEO audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this content for SEO compliance. Flag any claims without sources and assign confidence scores where data is available.

output_examples.input: Check if 'best CRM for agencies' is a verifiable claim
output: Status: NOT VERIFIABLE - vanity metric rejected
Recommendation: Replace with specific, measurable claim backed by data
Example: 'Rated #2 CRM for agencies by G2 with 4.5 stars (DataForSEO, high confidence)'

best_practices: Always cite specific data sources for every SEO claim
Use confidence scores to distinguish between direct measurements and estimates
Flag uncertain claims for human review rather than publishing unverified statistics
anti_patterns: Making absolute claims without verifiable ranking data
Publishing dated statistics without timestamps or source attribution
Using confidence scores below 70 percent without clear uncertainty language

faq.question: Which SEO data sources does this skill support?
faq.answer: DataForSEO, SEMRush, Google Search Console, and Ahrefs. Add new sources to the protocol rules.

faq.question: What confidence levels are used?
faq.answer: High (90+ percent), medium (70-89 percent), low (50-69 percent), and uncertain (below 50 percent). Uncertain claims require review.

faq.question: Does this skill make API calls?
faq.answer: No. The skill defines protocol rules. Your application handles actual API calls to DataForSEO and SEMRush.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. No data leaves your environment. API calls are handled by your configured tools.

faq.question: Why are vanity metrics rejected?
faq.answer: Claims like best in class are unverifiable and can damage credibility. Specific numbers with sources build trust.

faq.question: How does this differ from other SEO tools?
faq.answer: Focuses on claim verification and transparency rather than optimization. Every claim gets a confidence score and source.
